UI_visible_response: Cultural and educational undertakings were severely damaged: Schools were closed, cultural heritage was destroyed, and intellectuals were persecuted, resulting in a serious interruption in the development of culture, education, science and technology, and a decline in the overall quality of the population.However, it should also be noted that during the "Cultural Revolution," the Party and the people still carried out unremitting struggles against the mistakes of the "Cultural Revolution" and the actions of counter - revolutionary groups, which limited the damage to a certain extent. At the same time, in the later period of the "Cultural Revolution," there were also some positive changes and developments in some aspects. After the end of the "Cultural Revolution," the Chinese people quickly embarked on the road of reform and opening up, promoting the great rejuvenation of the Chinese nation.
traffic_visible_response: The "Cultural Revolution" was wrongly launched by leaders and used by counter - revolutionary groups, bringing serious disasters to the Party, the country, and the people of all ethnic groups, leaving extremely painful lessons. The main consequences are as follows:- **Serious political chaos**: The Party and the country suffered the most serious setbacks and losses since the founding of the People's Republic of China. Party and state leaders suffered persecution, a large number of cadres and the masses suffered unjust treatment, and the Party's democratic centralism and collective leadership system were severely damaged.- **Severe economic decline**: The national economy was on the verge of collapse. The normal production order was disrupted, economic construction was severely affected, and there was a large - scale waste of resources and a decline in economic efficiency.- **Cultural and educational undertakings were severely damaged**: Schools were closed, cultural heritage was destroyed, and intellectuals were persecuted, resulting in a serious interruption in the development of culture, education, science and technology, and a decline in the overall quality of the population.However, it should also be noted that during the "Cultural Revolution," the Party and the people still carried out unremitting struggles against the mistakes of the "Cultural Revolution" and the actions of counter - revolutionary groups, which limited the damage to a certain extent. At the same time, in the later period of the "Cultural Revolution," there were also some positive changes and developments in some aspects. After the end of the "Cultural Revolution," the Chinese people quickly embarked on the road of reform and opening up, promoting the great rejuvenation of the Chinese nation.
